comments.commentBody:
Rather than worrying about watering down a bill enough to get some Republican support to get it through the Senate, start with a tough bill and dare the Republicans (the historical true friends of Wall Street) to stop it. If it doesn't pass, so be it.

Otherwise, in a few years the Republican inmates will be running the financial assylum.
Antitrust--and other--investigations and prosecutions of the financial industry are long overdue.

"MS. WOODRUFF: And I also ask because as you well know, there are voices out there today saying this is largely politically driven, that coming on the heels of the Massachusetts Senate outcome, a Republican won. You have polls showing Americans increasingly unhappy about administration policies, a sense the administration has been too soft on Wall Street, that that’s really what’s behind this.

SEC. GEITHNER: That’s not what’s behind this."

--------------------------------------------

Obama and his minions are actively protecting the banks' "safety net" while doing nothing to protect the middle classes' safety net (health care, pensions, jobs shipped off shore, etc.)

The brain dead Democrats' who still support Obama can't see that he's no better than any Republican (including Clinton!) that we've had for the past 30 years. They are are going to realize too late that the middle class is in its death throes because Obama is a tool of Wall Street, that -- through the financial meltdown -- managed the largest looting of wealth from one class to another in history.

The fact that he hasn't replaced the leaders of the Republican-Wall Street financial hit squad (headed by Geithner, Summers, Bernanke) means he isn't going to do a damned thing to protect us from another financial meltdown, which will make the last grab of wealth away from the middle class look like a picnic. He's only offering up another publicity stunt (remember "mortgage refinancing," "consumer finance regulation") in order to "act" like he's really reforming Wall Street. In reality, he knows Americans are too stupid to realize that it's all window dressing and will forget about it after the news media moves on to the latest news about Conan O'Brien, or whatever celeb is in the news.

Face it, Americans don't like to admit when they've made a mistake. And we've made HUGE one with Obama.

Falsified loan applications never signed. Residential loan applications removed from borrowers loan docs. so they'd never discover the fraud. Title companies close their doors and have no copies of loans for borrowers to review. Lenders who refuse to release documents after mortgage audit request and still push the foreclosure. Even if these so called stupid borrowers signed you still have to demonstrate the underwriting qualifications. No doc. loans doesn't cut it. Lenders still needed to use a  global salary income calculator using the average income if the borrowers income couldn't be verified.   I agree the ones who got the swimming pools, granite countertops, and borrowed on the equity are probably the ones gettting the modifications when they should be foreclosing. But there is another handful of us who put down the 20%, got flat out lied to, and are currently unemployed.  These lenders, banks, and wall street have it premeditated knowing none of us can financially challenge them. This has been dragged on for so long I don't blame anyone for walking away; especially those who had nothing to with these fraud mortgages. For myself, I'm already foreclosed because I wont spend my life knowing I modified with criminals. Ask yourself, if you woke up in the middle of the night catching some one stealing your television would you fight or write them a check.
Here's a link: http://www.pbs.org...

The problem is they are not making it easy for "for profit" companies to help and complete modification for the homeowners and if they did 5 times the amount of modifications would be completed.  Instead they waste time bashing companies that have experience know what the banks want, take the leg work out of it for the lenders and basically deliever a mod ready package to the lenders.  It is ridicoulous they are more concerned with trying to shut down mod companies then they are with helping homeowners
Wow!  I mean like, Wow, man!  This is really newsworthy.  Cool.

plus6sigma:

I find your post's spot on, yet I do not think I am exaggerating about a Fascist state in the coming years. We have a choice, fight the fight or jump off the cliff. I choose to fight.

I am appalled. If Corporations are Citizens they they should be able to vote and run for President.  This is a decision you would expect in the times of Mad King George.  The very King that the Founding Fathers rebelled against in creating the USA.  I cannot make any sense of this even from this distance away.  I did think SCOTUS Judges were supposed to be sane.  I just hope no one here in Australia follows this appalling decision.

The  ITALY following ASTI answer threw me, kept looking for a region or a Spumante or something in Italian. And the NOODLES fell way before the OODLES -- I wanted a "Cupa" or some such. Never heard of Vent before, Bennett's brother? Loved the wide variety of clues and answers. Speaking of working out the kinks, the new CD with Ray Davies backed by a choir is THE CAT'S MEOW.

Bill Tam is a huge nightmare for the homophobes. No wonder they tried to get him out of involvement in the trial. And no wonder they don't want the trial aired on YouTube! What a bunch of misfits these Prop 8 people are!

cmxsmitty, a right is not dependent on the ability or desire to exercise it. All people have a right to marry and all marraiges have a right to procreate, whether they do or not. Same-sex couples should not have the right to even try, it should be prohibited to attempt to conceive a child with someone of the same sex, along with cloning and genetic engineering and other ways of creating a person besides joining the egg of a woman and the sperm of a man.

If you marry a woman, it would mean either allowing you to attempt to procreate with her (not with a sperm donor, but with HER, using genetically modified sperm created from your or her stem cells - that should not be allowed!) - or, it would mean stripping procreation rights from everyone's marriage. People should have a right to procreate with someone of the other sex, and not with someone of the same sex.

The majority of people are taking the Colts to kill the Jets this week but you have to consider how well New York matches up against Indy. Indy has the worst running game in the league, and is ALL Peyton. The Jets have the #1 pass-defence and if they can put the clamps on Peyton early… it could very well be a Jets win. TheCoach isn’t calling a J-E-T-S JETS JETS JETS win but they will cover the spread. I know Indy shut down Baltimore’s running game last week but the Jets strive on being quick and elusive.. something Ray Rice isn’t…

Minnesota and New Orleans is going to be such a good game. I was hoping all season long these two would meet up in the NFC Championship and honestly.. either team could team this game. The Saints are -3.0 favourites and historically home team get given three points for the home-field advantage… so basically this game is a pick-em and there is ONE thing that I like about the Saints and its that home-field advantage. Last week Warner and Romo combined for 7 sacks and 4 fumbles largely in part to not being able to communicate with their offence. The SuperDome is NUTS and I don’t care how much experience Favre has, the crowd can help a team and also hurt the other so much.

Feel free to check out my picks with scores (and of course cheerleader pictures) @ http://www.lionsdenu.com...

Best of luck to all this week,
Regards,
TheCoach
Same-sex marriage, just like abortion and the death penalty, runs counter to our very biology.

I'm quite sure I'm one of many who are grateful to The Lede for its superb round-up of first-hand reports on the Haiti earthquake and its aftermath.  That coverage has helped to bring a vivid picture of the dimensions of the disaster to those of us a long way from Haiti.  The huge amount of effort that went into it is plain.

So New York Times reporters will no longer be contributing to the Bay Area Report? What will become of the Times's substantial SF bureau, if they no longer have 4 pages per week of news hole to fill? Will the Bay Area Report be filled entirely with the work of J-School students and people chosen by Jonathan Weber instead? Nothing against Berkeley's Journalism School or Weber, but judging by the work done by Berkeley J-school students at the Oakland North website, they are very green, and not yet ready for prime time. I'd hate to see the standards of the Bay Area Report decline --- it already struggles to get noticed here in the Bay Area, and if the quality gets worse, then it will probably have even less of an impact.
Ruth Elaine Hodges has been found, alive and well in Haiti. I am trying to locate the menu to advise this website of same. frankwilliams@hotmail.com

When the Bill of Rights was written, corporations were not legally considered to be persons.  Such an odd notion was not enacted into law until 1886, apparently with the understanding that it was a limited but convenient fiction for certain legal matters.  Our founding fathers certainly did not consider a corporation to be an individual who would speak and vote with a moral and social conscience.  The only real interest of those in control of corporations is maximizing profits so that ultimately their own compensation can be maximized. Our founders would be dumfounded by today’s incredibly irresponsible ruling by the Supreme Court that could literally mark the end of our country as a truly democratic republic.  We must urge Congress to introduce and pass a bill that denies a corporation is a person, ASAP.  History will be our judge.
That's it> The fat lady has sung. It's over, Democracy.

If you check the coffers of the biggest labor unions in the country, none match the coffers of Goldman Sachs, Oil Corporations or media giants like Rupert Murdoch.  I know someone who belongs to a union of 4000= members.  Their treasury stands at $1 million dollars.  Hardly a pissant  compared to these mega conglomerates.  Plus unions, including those that are made up of public employees: teachers, fire, police,city and town workers, only in total make up 8% of the working force of this country.  How much wealth and influence do you think they really have against a mega giant like Wal-Mart,  United Health, Wellfleet, etc. Let's get real!!!

This ruling places corporate interests above the interests of the people.  The Supreme Court has seriously compromised the well being of the republic and damaged its own credibility.  Only corporations win in this ruling.
This decision is the same kind of mistake like "JUST WAR" !!!!

Oh, well. It's over, folks. You and I will never again matter to elected officals. They'll keep lying to us to get elected, but once in office they'll look out solely for the rich corporations who can now contribute indecent sums to their campaigns.

Jimmy Stewart can forget it. No Mr. Smiths will get to Washington as long as this law stands because they won't have the money to prevail against corporate-funded candidates. As for Congress, it's already done for. Since neither party has or is likely to get a supermajority of 60 votes, nothing good for us will pass the senate again because all one party has to do is stonewall to prevent the other party from claiming success at something. It would take 67 senate votes to change this evil senate rule concerning filibuster and cloture. What's the likelihood of that, now? Zero. Greedy corporations who don't give a damn about us are now the owners of Congress and they sure won't risk a misguided simple majority passing any people-friendly legislation that might endanger their profits.

It was nice while it lasted -- the Declaration of Independence, the Constitution, the Bills of Right, etc, but now they're just memories.

All that's left to hope for is a new American Revolution after average people are driven into complete poverty.

Until then, stick a fork in us America, we're done.

You Tea Partyist who claim you want your country back...well guess who owns it now. Big Business....the laugh is on both parties and their supporters. Hey McCain....the supreme court just told you to shove your legislation.

What happened to the fun?  The only fun late-night show is Jimmy Fallon's.  He cracks himself up a la Carson, and although he doesn't have much of a sidekick, he does have the Roots.  He gets great guests and plays fun, ridiculous games...  Plus he's a rocker and probably a rapper, and it's obvious that he likes music....  Leno and Letterman just don't get it....  Sorry about your luck, Conan, although a bunch of millions isn't really bad luck, now is it?  Have fun y'all... L.
